I would recommend "Restless" as a Bildungsroman movie option. The film follows Ari, who is described as being restless and not feeling like anything. The film explores themes of identity, relationships, and the pursuit of happiness.
Another recommended option is "The Seduction of Joe Tynan". This film follows Dr. Ken, a leading Hong Kong scientist, who is asked to lead the opposition to a Supreme Court appointment. The film explores themes of power, politics, and the impact of decisions made in high positions.
Lastly, I would recommend "Little Women" as a Bildungsroman movie option. The film follows four sisters - Meg, Amy, Beth - who are living and growing in post-Civil War America.
